Corquin is not frequented by travelers. Members of the Peace Corps are the primary visitors to the area.
Two primary ways to enter the town are by taking a chicken bus from Santa Rosa de Copan or by hitchhiking. Hitchhiking is a common practice in rural Honduran areas.
You will be able to navigate through much of the town on foot.
There is a local farmer's market. Purchase some of the locally grown coffee beans.
There is an internet cafe in town.
